- load org.eclipse.test from desktop repository (see attached)
- select fragment.xml in packages view
- choose Create Fragment JARs

Created an attachment (id=334)
Zip file containing org.eclipse.test

This is an interesting case because you have both a fragment and a plug-in in 
the same project. PDE keeps a cache of plug-in and fragment models it creates 
by reacting to resource changes. It considers a fragment project any Java 
project with fragment.xml in project root. Similarly, plug-in project is a Java 
project with plugin.xml. So it looks like PDE creates two model objects (one 
for plug-in, one for fragment) that point to the same underlying project. 

I tried the scenario and it worked - I was able to create JARs. However, since 
both plug-in and fragment have the same library name (automated.jar) building a 
plug-in after a fragment will result in loosing the fragment version.

There must be something with your workspace that causes PDE to crash. Try 
reimporting external projects using new PDE import wizard. It will not do any 
damage and may help. 

In addition, I would consider moving the fragment into a separate project. 
Otherwise, you need to be careful what you build and in what order.
Old bug, closing. Reopen if still a problem.
